alert.note: Alert for Kern; Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 11 at 12:48AM PST until March 11 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Kern County in central California... Southeastern Tulare County in central California... * Until 800 AM PST Saturday. * At 1248 AM PST, Emergency management reported flash flooding across the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bodfish, Lake Isabella, Riverkern, Kernville and Wofford Heights. This includes the following streams and drainages... Tillie Creek, Kern River, Caldwell Creek, Tobias Creek, Bull Run Creek, Salmon Creek, South Creek, Erskine Creek, Brush Creek, South Fork Kern River, Bodfish Creek, Cannell Creek and Corral Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
